intro: Taraxacum expallidum, commonly known as the pale dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the dandelion genus, which is part of the Asteraceae family, known for its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, pale green leaves and produces a single, elongated flower stem topped with a yellow composite flower. It is characterized by its pale yellow coloration and is often found in meadows and grasslands. The plant is also noted for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and its role in supporting pollinators.
